author: Louise Radnofsky
title: How the Pyeongchang Olympics Delivered a Figure Skating Revolution - WSJ
text:
GANGNEUNG, South Korea—The months before the 2018 Olympics were dominated by a woman who competed before the majority of today’s figure skaters were even born. 

“I, Tonya,” the movie about Tonya Harding and her life before the 1994 attack on Nancy Kerrigan that riveted the world and kickstarted the American fascination with figure skating, was suddenly everywhere. Some of the most intrigued viewers were figure skaters themselves. So much time had passed that they needed a Hollywood portrayal to understand a seminal event...
